channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2024081238
item.description:
Report X-2024081238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-27T06:25:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Yard personnel reported ice buildup on the exterior of the protective housing and a strong odor behind the car. Code 3, contractor, was dispatched and upon arrival found the liquid valve open and the plug less than tool tight, resulting in liquid spraying out and freezing. A large chunk of ice was noted on the valve and housing walls. The valve was closed, the plug retefloned and then properly secured with no other issues found. The car continued in transportation after the ice melted off.
